intro: Lepechiniella persica, commonly known as Persian lepechiniella, is a small, flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pale blue or violet, and they bloom during the summer months. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, temperate climates.
